name: 2012_02_humanities_student_major_205_gradschool
title: 2012-02-humanities-student-major_205_GradSchool.txt
content_scrubbed:
I'm a 7th year grad doctoral student with a 2-year-old. Was it foolish? Nope. Risky? Of course. But having a baby is risky no matter who you are or what you do for a living. I agree with Arabis -- there isn't a firm yes or no answer -- you make a decision that you feel comfortable with. 

If you're anything like me, or any graduate student, you're a planner. Here[.] how the past 7 years looked for me. I'm a humanities doctoral student.

**Year One.** Moved across the country to [Insert ridiculously expensive city here]. Coursework.

**Year Two.** Coursework, conferences, drinking, complaining

**Year Three.** Comprehensive exams, TA-ing, planned a wedding
[married, honeymoon, lost momentum on diss proposal]

**Year Four.** Teaching, Teaching, diss proposal writing (not finishing), got pregnant

**Year Five.** Defended diss proposal in the Fall, had baby in January, took Spring term unofficially off (I needed the health insurance and pre-arranged with my committee -- this part can be tricky depending on your discipline/department/committee)

**Year Six.** Won a teaching fellowship, hired a nanny (ate up my entire stipend + teaching pay and we lived off my husband[.] salary), teaching, research, taking it a day at a time

**Year Seven.** Out of money. Living off husband[.] salary, staying at home and writing. It[.] working surprisingly well, I work and write during naps and on weekends. Just started Chapter 3.


Hope this helps.

Edits: Formatting
